intro: Calonyction bona-nox subvar. hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy nightshade, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its scientific name. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
